1.text: Then Jesus, six days before the pascha, came to Bethany, where was Lazarus the dead, whom he raised from the dead.

2.text: Then made they him a supper there, and Martha served; and Lazarus was one of them reclining at table with him.

3.text: Then Mary having taken a pound of perfumed oil of spikenard, very precious, anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hairs: and the house was filled with the smell of the perfumed oil.

4.text: Then says one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, of Simon, being about to deliver him up,

5.text: Wherefore was not this perfumed oil sold for three hundred drachmas, and given to the poor?

6.text: And this he said, not that care was to him for the poor: but because he was a thief, and had the small coffer, and carried things deposited.

7.text: Then said Jesus, Let her go; for the day of my interment has she kept this.

8.text: For the poor have ye always with you; and me ye have not always.

9.text: Then a great crowd of Jews knew that he is there: and they came not for Jesus alone, but that also they might see Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.

10.text: And the chief priests took counsel that they might also kill Lazarus;

11.text: Because many for him retired, and believed in Jesus.

12.text: The morrow a great crowd, having come to the festival, having heard that Jesus comes to Jerusalem,

13.text: Took branches of palm trees, and went forth to the meeting to him, and cried, Praised he coming in the name of the Lord, King of Israel.

14.text: And Jesus having found a small ass, sat upon it; as it is written,

15.text: Fear not, O daughter of Sion: behold, thy King comes, sitting upon the foal of an ass.

16.text: And these the disciples knew not at first: but when Jesus was honoured, then remembered they that these were written of him, and they did these things to him.

17.text: The crowd therefore testified which being with him, that he called Lazarus out of the tomb, and raised him from the dead.

18.text: And for this the crowd met him, for they heard he had done this sign.

19.text: Then said the Pharisees among themselves, Ye see that ye aid nothing; behold, the world has departed after him.

20.text: And there were certain Greeks of those going up that they might worship in the festival:

21.text: These then came to Philip, him of Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, saying, Lord, we wish to see Jesus.

22.text: Philip comes and says to Andrew: and again Andrew and Philip say to Jesus.

23.text: And Jesus answered them, saying, The hour has come, that the Son of man should be honoured.

24.text: Truly, truly, I say to you, except a kernel of wheat, having fallen into the earth, should die, it remains alone: and if it should die, it brings forth much fruit.

25.text: He loving his soul shall lose it; but he hating his soul in this world, shall guard it for life eternal.

26.text: If any one would serve me, let him follow me; and where I am, there also shall be my servant: and if any one serve me, him will the Father honour.

27.text: Now has my soul been troubled; and what should I say? O Father, save me from this hour: but for this came I to this hour.

28.text: Father, honour thy name. Then came a voice from heaven, I have also honoured, and will again honour.

29.text: Then the crowd, having stood and heard, said it was thunder: others said, A messenger has spoken to him.

30.text: Jesus answered and said, This voice has not been for me, but for you.

31.text: Now is the judgment of this world: now shall the ruler of this world be cast out.

32.text: And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw all to myself.

33.text: This said he, signifying what death he was about to die.

34.text: The crowd answered him, We have heard out of the law that Christ remains forever: and how sayest thou That the Son of man must be lifted up? who is this Son of man?

35.text: Then said Jesus to them, Yet a little time the light is with you. Walk while ye have light, lest darkness overtake you: and he walking in darkness knows not where he retires.

36.text: While ye have light, believe in the light, that ye might be the sons of light. These things spake Jesus, and having departed, he was hid from them.

37.text: And he having done so many signs before them, they did not believe in him:

38.text: That the word of Esaias the prophet might be completed, which he spake, Lord, who believed our report? and to whom was the arm of the Lord revealed?

39.text: Therefore they could not believe, for Esaias said again,

40.text: He has blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart: lest they see with the eyes, and understand with the heart, and should turn back, and I should heal them.

41.text: These said Esaias, when he saw his glory, and spake of him.

42.text: Yet nevertheless also many of the rulers believed in him; but on account of the Pharisees they did not acknowledge, lest they should be excluded from the synagogue:

43.text: For they loved the honour of men more than the honour of God.

44.text: Jesus cried and said, He believing in me, believes not in me, but in him having sent me.

45.text: And he seeing me, sees him having sent me.

46.text: I have come a light into the world, that every one believing in me should not remain in darkness.

47.text: And if any hear my words, and believe not, I judge him not: for I came not that I might judge the world, but that I might save the world.

48.text: He rejecting me, and not receiving my words, has him judging him: the word which I spake, that shall judge him in the last day.

49.text: For I spake not of myself; but the Father having sent me, he gave me a command, what I should say, and what I should speak.

50.text: And I know that his command is life eternal: therefore what I speak, as the Father said to me, so I speak.
